title: Years in the making, Quincy’s new MBTA parking garage opens Monday
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: The new parking garage at North Quincy MBTA station opens Monday after six years of construction.
Over 1,500 parking spaces are available, with 852 for MBTA and 700 for residential and retail use.
Daily parking rates are $5 on weekdays, $3 on weekends, with overnight parking permitted.

title: N.H. leads 25 states in seeking Supreme Court review of ‘unconstitutional’ Mass. gun law
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: New Hampshire and 24 GOP-led states challenge Massachusetts gun law affecting out-of-state visitors at the U.S. Supreme Court.
The dispute centers on Pheasant Lane Mall, where crossing state lines with a gun could lead to felony charges.
The Massachusetts Supreme Judicial Court upheld the state's gun laws as constitutional under the nation's historical firearm regulations.

title: Dua Lipa loved this North End restaurant so much she went there twice
author: Darin Zullo
bullets: Dua Lipa dined at Neptune Oyster in Boston's North End, enjoying its lobster roll and oysters.
The popstar also enjoyed martinis at The Red Fox, an Italian restaurant from All Day Hospitality Group.
Dua Lipa performed at TD Garden on September 9-10 as part of her 'Radical Optimism' tour.

title: 2025 Emmys predictions: Who will win, who will get snubbed
author: Kevin Slane
bullets: The 2025 Emmys will air Sunday at 8 p.m. on CBS and stream on Paramount+.
Predicted big winners include 'Severance,' 'Adolescence,' and 'The Studio,' despite some debates over deserving shows.
Notable snubs may include 'Andor' for Best Drama and Britt Lower for Best Actress in Drama.

title: Alex Bregman shares his advice for younger Red Sox teammates down the stretch
author: Colin McCarthy
bullets: Alex Bregman advises younger Red Sox players to simplify their game, emphasizing 'less is more' during the season's final stretch.
Red Sox hold the American League's second wildcard spot with a record of 81-68, needing to secure their postseason position.
Bregman, a veteran MLB player, hit his first home run since August 12 in Saturday's 5-3 loss to the Yankees.

title: 3 takeaways from the Revolution’s 1-1 draw vs. Toronto FC
author: Hayden Bird
bullets: New England Revolution drew 1-1 against Toronto FC at Gillette Stadium, with a late equalizer from Luca Langoni.
The Revolution are in 11th place in the Eastern Conference and still technically in playoff contention despite challenges.
Eighteen-year-old Allan Oyirwoth made his first MLS start, showing potential in central midfield for New England.

title: ‘We should stop talking October’: Alex Cora doesn’t want Red Sox to start thinking about playoffs yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Alex Cora advises the Red Sox to focus on present games instead of discussing playoff scenarios early.
The Red Sox hold a strong 90%+ postseason chance despite a current slump and fierce competition from the Rangers.
Injuries affect the Red Sox lineup against left-handed pitchers, challenging Cora's game strategy avoiding early playoff focus.

title: Red Sox CBO Craig Breslow reportedly prioritizing finding a GM this offseason
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Craig Breslow is seeking a general manager for the Red Sox this offseason as his second-in-command.
The general manager position has been vacant since Breslow assumed charge of Red Sox operations in 2024.
Red Sox assistant general managers Raquel Ferreira, Eddie Romero, and others are potential candidates for the GM role.

title: Patriots move on from Ja’Lynn Polk, reportedly trading him to Saints
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Patriots trade wide receiver Ja'Lynn Polk to the Saints, receiving a 2027 sixth-round pick in exchange.
Polk, drafted in the second round in 2024, struggled with performance and injuries as a rookie.
Trade leaves only two players remaining from the Patriots' 2024 draft class, including third overall pick Drake Maye.

title: 5 things to know about Dolphins before Patriots take them on in Week 2
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots have lost their last five games in Miami and face Tua Tagovailoa, who is undefeated against them.
Despite Miami Dolphins' blowout loss to the Colts in Week 1, Tua Tagovailoa has a strong record against New England.
Dolphins' pass rush led by Bradley Chubb and Zach Sieler poses a challenge for the Patriots' offensive line in Week 2.
